content: this is a filet crochet pattern where the design is made up by making chain-space stitches because of this the easiest way to demonstrate this pattern is using a chart i know not everyone likes reading charts trust me this one is super simple though and so i ve also included written instructions for each row **suggested yarn ** this pattern has been designed for use with one ball of scheepjes whirl it s a 4ply fingering weight yarn so substituting with any similar yarn should work **finished size** 158cm wide by 46cm deep blocked **gauge ** 21 5 stitches per 10cm and 12 row per 10 cm pre-blocking using treble_crochet stitches if you are using scheepjes whirl gauge is fairly important it is designed to use one ball and to get the full effect of the colour transition it uses pretty much the whole ball you might have a little bit left over **suitable for ** anyone with experience of making chain and treble_crochet stitches i ve tried my best to explain the stages as simply as possible i ve also included some hints and tips on my blog to help you can find those here 1 1 http //www jo-creates com/2017/07/10/scheepjes-whirl-pattern-rough-diamonds
